sentences.sContent: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.sCn: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

sentences.sContent: ...they do a vast number of concerts...
...a vast four-year global study which reported its initial conclusions earlier this year...
...but a more crucial concern is that both are basing major policy decisions on guesstimates rather than looking at the vast wealth of raw data with a critical eye and an open mind...
...holding up the global economy with vast amounts of money in the form of asset buying...
...Smith's book serves as an excellent introduction to a vast subject...
...companies have begun to plan more affordable "suborbital" flights-briefer ventures just to the edge of space's vast darkness...
...unlike the vast majority of principals around the world...
...as a cultural influence that shaped thinking and behavior in vast sections of the country...
...And at the vast majority of places...
...scientists say that the scale of CO2 emissions will require vast amounts of long-term storage...

synos.tran: 广阔的；巨大的；大量的；巨额的

trans.tranCn: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
